p: An increasing consciousness about the opportunities offered at various levels by insects to different branches of emerging bioeconomical issues is largely arising. Besides other potential utilizations of several species for human nutrition, new perspectives have been opened, for example, to utilize silkworm by-products as the fibroin for advanced hi-tech industrial applications [ 39, 40]. Also, in that case, coloured strains demonstrated their remarkable value. The study carried out here identifies the interesting opportunity for a fully-closed circular B. mori. production, including the use of dried pupae in a protein production chain.
